name: Portfolio Default
description: Default scoring template for all patents. Provides base questions that can be inherited and overridden by sector-specific templates.

questions.question: Rate the technical novelty of this patent's core innovation. Consider: How different is this from prior art? Does it represent a significant departure from existing approaches?
questions.reasoningPrompt: Explain what makes this technically novel or incremental.

questions.question: Rate the breadth of the patent claims. Consider: How broadly do the claims cover the invention? Could they capture variations and alternative implementations?
questions.reasoningPrompt: Describe the scope of the claims.

questions.question: How difficult would it be for a competitor to design around this patent while achieving similar functionality?
questions.reasoningPrompt: Explain what makes this hard or easy to design around.

questions.question: Rate the relevance of this technology to current market needs and industry trends.
questions.reasoningPrompt: Describe the market context and relevance.

questions.question: How clearly does the patent describe the implementation? Could infringement be easily detected in a product?
questions.reasoningPrompt: Assess detectability and clarity of implementation.

questions.question: Is this patent related to any industry standards (IEEE, 3GPP, IETF, etc.)? Rate its standards essentiality.

Beyond the standard metrics above, does this patent have unique or overlooked value that isn't captured by typical analysis? Consider: unusual claim scope, emerging technology applicability, underappreciated market timing, strategic defensive value, or any 'dark horse' characteristics that could make this patent more valuable than it appears.
questions.reasoningPrompt: Identify any unique characteristics, hidden strengths, or overlooked value that distinguishes this patent from others in its sector. What makes this a potential 'dark horse' that standard analysis might miss? Be specific about what unique value exists and why it matters.
